instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message: SSD is ok, checked it on other macbook. Cant find any problem on logic board. No water damage. Just stop working 1 day.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message:
Is the original SSD from that board?
No APFS issue for sure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message: yes, original, no apfs issue. In Disk utility there is no disk.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message: Also checked connector from inside and all pins are present ( no broken pin or something like that)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message:
Replaced <CHIP>U3740</CHIP> and now get:

1 - 3.4 V
2 - 1V
3- 3.3 V
4- 3.4V

5- 0V
6 - 3.2V
7 - 0.4V-0.7V Pulsing
8 - 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message:
Now all voltages are correct.
Still not detecting SSD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message:
No.

Pin 8 0V is ok?

Also sometime pin 7 is giving 1.2V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message:
Pins 7 & 8 must be 0V, all the time SSD is connected.
Pay atention at end "_L" in the signal names...

Check for acorrosion around <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11, be sure <RESISTOR>R3700</RESISTOR>/03 are good.
Also check all the caps from PCIE lines of SSD.
Compare diode mode readings on the data lines to ground, with known good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message: thanks informaticos. So my pin 7 is wrong if it 1.2V now. Will check it all tomorrow and write here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message:
Thanks. IT was <CAPACITOR>C3717</CAPACITOR>. 

Note: Pin 7 and Pin 8 on 3740 is 1.2V when SSD is conected and working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not detecting SSD
threads.message: 1.2V not really good, but low enough under high level threeshold.
